  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts

          </button>
        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        
          
            
              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    Shift-O<kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">

        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        <slot></slot>
      </button>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1381401: Security: UAF in VideoCaptureDeviceWin
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1381401: Security: UAF in VideoCaptureDeviceWin
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      leecraso@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2715333234" title="leecraso@gmail.com"><!---->leecraso@gmail.com<!----></a>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>There is a race between `client_.reset` and `client_->OnIncomingCapturedData`:<span class="line"><!---->There is a race between `client_.reset` and `client_-&gt;OnIncomingCapturedData`:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::StopAndDeAllocate() {<span class="line"><!---->void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::StopAndDeAllocate() {<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>  HRESULT hr = media_control_->Stop();    // <<<---------[3]<span class="line"><!---->  HRESULT hr = media_control_-&gt;Stop();    // &lt;&lt;&lt;---------[3]<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>  {<span class="line"><!---->  {<!----></span><br>    base::AutoLock lock(lock_);<span class="line"><!---->    base::AutoLock lock(lock_);<!----></span><br>    client_.reset();   //<<<------[1]<span class="line"><!---->    client_.reset();   //&lt;&lt;&lt;------[1]<!----></span><br>    state_ = kIdle;<span class="line"><!---->    state_ = kIdle;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived(const uint8_t* buffer,<span class="line"><!---->void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived(const uint8_t* buffer,<!----></span><br>                                          int length,<span class="line"><!---->                                          int length,<!----></span><br>                                          const VideoCaptureFormat& format,<span class="line"><!---->                                          const VideoCaptureFormat&amp; format,<!----></span><br>                                          base::TimeDelta timestamp,<span class="line"><!---->                                          base::TimeDelta timestamp,<!----></span><br>                                          bool flip_y) {<span class="line"><!---->                                          bool flip_y) {<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>  client_->OnIncomingCapturedData(buffer, length, format, gfx::ColorSpace(),   //<<<------[2]<span class="line"><!---->  client_-&gt;OnIncomingCapturedData(buffer, length, format, gfx::ColorSpace(),   //&lt;&lt;&lt;------[2]<!----></span><br>                                  camera_rotation_.value(), flip_y,<span class="line"><!---->                                  camera_rotation_.value(), flip_y,<!----></span><br>                                  base::TimeTicks::Now(), timestamp);<span class="line"><!---->                                  base::TimeTicks::Now(), timestamp);<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>So if the `client_` is reset during the execution of `OnIncomingCapturedData`, the uaf will be triggered.<span class="line"><!---->So if the `client_` is reset during the execution of `OnIncomingCapturedData`, the uaf will be triggered.<!----></span><br><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=568;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=568;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=568;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=900;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=900;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=900;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<!----></a><br><br><br>By the way, for some devices which use ksproxy filter, the pending event may block the `Stop`[3] function (and also the following `client_.reset()`):<span class="line"><!---->By the way, for some devices which use ksproxy filter, the pending event may block the `Stop`[3] function (and also the following `client_.reset()`):<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>media_control_->Stop()<span class="line"><!---->media_control_-&gt;Stop()<!----></span><br>  => quartz!CFGControl::CImplMediaControl::Stop<span class="line"><!---->  =&gt; quartz!CFGControl::CImplMediaControl::Stop<!----></span><br>    => quartz!CFilterGraph::Stop<span class="line"><!---->    =&gt; quartz!CFilterGraph::Stop<!----></span><br>     => for i in filters : i->Stop()<span class="line"><!---->     =&gt; for i in filters : i-&gt;Stop()<!----></span><br>           => FilterBase::Stop() [4]<span class="line"><!---->           =&gt; FilterBase::Stop() [4]<!----></span><br>           => ksproxy!CKsProxy::Stop<span class="line"><!---->           =&gt; ksproxy!CKsProxy::Stop<!----></span><br>             => ksproxy!CKsOutputPin::Inactive<span class="line"><!---->             =&gt; ksproxy!CKsOutputPin::Inactive<!----></span><br>CKsOutputPin::Inactive(CKsOutputPin *this){<span class="line"><!---->CKsOutputPin::Inactive(CKsOutputPin *this){<!----></span><br>	[...]<span class="line"><!---->	[...]<!----></span><br>	 if ( this->m_PendingIoCount )<span class="line"><!---->	 if ( this-&gt;m_PendingIoCount )<!----></span><br>       WaitForSingleObjectEx(this->m_PendingIoCompletedEvent, 0xFFFFFFFF, 0); // will wait for the signal.<span class="line"><!---->       WaitForSingleObjectEx(this-&gt;m_PendingIoCompletedEvent, 0xFFFFFFFF, 0); // will wait for the signal.<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>This will prevent this race from happening.<span class="line"><!---->This will prevent this race from happening.<!----></span><br><br><br>But for the devices whose filter is implemented in a non-blocking way, this UAF will be unavoidable. Take obs virtual camera as an example:<span class="line"><!---->But for the devices whose filter is implemented in a non-blocking way, this UAF will be unavoidable. Take obs virtual camera as an example:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>media_control_->Stop()<span class="line"><!---->media_control_-&gt;Stop()<!----></span><br>  => quartz!CFGControl::CImplMediaControl::Stop<span class="line"><!---->  =&gt; quartz!CFGControl::CImplMediaControl::Stop<!----></span><br>    => quartz!CFilterGraph::Stop<span class="line"><!---->    =&gt; quartz!CFilterGraph::Stop<!----></span><br>     => for i in filters : i->Stop()<span class="line"><!---->     =&gt; for i in filters : i-&gt;Stop()<!----></span><br>           => FilterBase::Stop() [4]<span class="line"><!---->           =&gt; FilterBase::Stop() [4]<!----></span><br>           => obs_virtualcam_module64!DShow::OutputFilter::Stop<span class="line"><!---->           =&gt; obs_virtualcam_module64!DShow::OutputFilter::Stop<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>`obs_virtualcam_module64!DShow::OutputFilter::Stop` will not wait for the signal.<span class="line"><!---->`obs_virtualcam_module64!DShow::OutputFilter::Stop` will not wait for the signal.<!----></span><br><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=555;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<a class="undefined" <span class="line"><!---->[4]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/filter_base_win.cc;l=115;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<a Suggestion:<span class="line"><!---->Fix Suggestion:<!----></span><br><br>diff --git a/media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc b/media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc<span b/media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc<!----></span><br>@@ -897,9 +897,12 @@ void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived(const uint8_t* buffer,<span class="line"><!---->@@ -897,9 +897,12 @@ void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived(const uint8_t* buffer,<!----></span><br>   // DXVA_ExtendedFormat. Then use its fields DXVA_VideoPrimaries,<span class="line"><!---->   // DXVA_ExtendedFormat. Then use its fields DXVA_VideoPrimaries,<!----></span><br>   // DXVA_VideoTransferMatrix, DXVA_VideoTransferFunction and<span class="line"><!---->   // DXVA_VideoTransferMatrix, DXVA_VideoTransferFunction and<!----></span><br>   // DXVA_NominalRangeto build a gfx::ColorSpace. See <span class="line"><!---->   // DXVA_NominalRangeto build a gfx::ColorSpace. See <!----></span>http://crbug.com/959992<a class="" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=959992" title="Video capture with DirectShow does not take color space into account"><!---->http://crbug.com/959992<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br>-  client_->OnIncomingCapturedData(buffer, length, format, gfx::ColorSpace(),<span class="line"><!---->-  client_-&gt;OnIncomingCapturedData(buffer, length, format, gfx::ColorSpace(),<!----></span><br>+  {<span class="line"><!---->+  {<!----></span><br>+    base::AutoLock lock(lock_);<span client_-&gt;OnIncomingCapturedData(buffer, length, format, gfx::ColorSpace(),<!----></span><br>                                   camera_rotation_.value(), flip_y,<span class="line"><!---->                                   camera_rotation_.value(), flip_y,<!----></span><br>                                   base::TimeTicks::Now(), timestamp);<span class="line"><!---->                                   base::TimeTicks::Now(), timestamp);<!----></span><br>+  }<span class="line"><!---->+  }<!----></span><br><br>   while (!take_photo_callbacks_.empty()) {<span class="line"><!---->   while (!take_photo_callbacks_.empty()) {<!----></span><br>     TakePhotoCallback cb = std::move(take_photo_callbacks_.front());<span class="line"><!---->     TakePhotoCallback cb = std::move(take_photo_callbacks_.front());<!----></span><br><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: win<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: win<!----></span><br><br>Bisect:<span class="line"><!---->Bisect:<!----></span><br><br>Issue 1137308<span class="line"><!---->Issue 1137308<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>added a lock `lock_` to solve the race problem. But since [a], it changed the scope of `lock_` in order to fix deadlock, which let the UAF free again.<span class="line"><!---->added a lock `lock_` to solve the race problem. But since [a], it changed the scope of `lock_` in order to fix deadlock, which let the UAF free again.<!----></span><br><br>[a]. <span class="line"><!---->[a]. --user-data-dir=xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome.exe --user-data-dir=xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br><br>(Make sure your device has a camera, you can download the obs and use its virtual camera: <span class="line"><!---->(Make sure your device has a camera, you can download the obs and use its virtual camera: <!----></span>https://obsproject.com/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://obsproject.com/"><!---->https://obsproject.com/<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br><br>Type of crash: VideoCaptureService utility process, medium integrity as browser process on Win.<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: VideoCaptureService utility process, medium integrity as browser process on Win.<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file.<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan file.<!----></span><br><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang         Yes, this is a real issue. Previously there was a deadlock there, so the locking was relaxed. Turns out it was relaxed too much.<span class="line"><!---->Yes, this is a real issue. Previously there was a deadlock there, so the locking was relaxed. Turns out it was relaxed too much.<!----></span><br><br>However, I suggest not to grab the lock two times, but hold it throughout the |VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived|.<span class="line"><!---->However, I suggest not to grab the lock two times, but hold it throughout the |VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived|.<!----></span><br><br>I'm working on a fix.<span class="line"><!---->I'm working on a fix.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;

        }

          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;

          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;

          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

          min-width: 256px;

          padding: 0.5em 16px;

          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;

        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);

          overflow-y: auto;

          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }

    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }

      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;

    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {

      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }

        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">

          </button>

              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>

                </span>

                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">

                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>

                  <!---->:
                </span>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">

        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        <slot></slot>
      </button>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1381401: Security: UAF in VideoCaptureDeviceWin
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1381401: Security: UAF in VideoCaptureDeviceWin
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      leecraso@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2715333234" title="leecraso@gmail.com"><!---->leecraso@gmail.com<!----></a>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>There is a race between `client_.reset` and `client_->OnIncomingCapturedData`:<span class="line"><!---->There is a race between `client_.reset` and `client_-&gt;OnIncomingCapturedData`:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::StopAndDeAllocate() {<span class="line"><!---->void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::StopAndDeAllocate() {<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>  HRESULT hr = media_control_->Stop();    // <<<---------[3]<span class="line"><!---->  HRESULT hr = media_control_-&gt;Stop();    // &lt;&lt;&lt;---------[3]<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>  {<span class="line"><!---->  {<!----></span><br>    base::AutoLock lock(lock_);<span class="line"><!---->    base::AutoLock lock(lock_);<!----></span><br>    client_.reset();   //<<<------[1]<span class="line"><!---->    client_.reset();   //&lt;&lt;&lt;------[1]<!----></span><br>    state_ = kIdle;<span class="line"><!---->    state_ = kIdle;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived(const uint8_t* buffer,<span class="line"><!---->void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived(const uint8_t* buffer,<!----></span><br>                                          int length,<span class="line"><!---->                                          int length,<!----></span><br>                                          const VideoCaptureFormat& format,<span class="line"><!---->                                          const VideoCaptureFormat&amp; format,<!----></span><br>                                          base::TimeDelta timestamp,<span class="line"><!---->                                          base::TimeDelta timestamp,<!----></span><br>                                          bool flip_y) {<span class="line"><!---->                                          bool flip_y) {<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>  client_->OnIncomingCapturedData(buffer, length, format, gfx::ColorSpace(),   //<<<------[2]<span class="line"><!---->  client_-&gt;OnIncomingCapturedData(buffer, length, format, gfx::ColorSpace(),   //&lt;&lt;&lt;------[2]<!----></span><br>                                  camera_rotation_.value(), flip_y,<span class="line"><!---->                                  camera_rotation_.value(), flip_y,<!----></span><br>                                  base::TimeTicks::Now(), timestamp);<span class="line"><!---->                                  base::TimeTicks::Now(), timestamp);<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>So if the `client_` is reset during the execution of `OnIncomingCapturedData`, the uaf will be triggered.<span class="line"><!---->So if the `client_` is reset during the execution of `OnIncomingCapturedData`, the uaf will be triggered.<!----></span><br><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=568;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=568;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=568;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=900;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=900;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=900;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<!----></a><br><br><br>By the way, for some devices which use ksproxy filter, the pending event may block the `Stop`[3] function (and also the following `client_.reset()`):<span class="line"><!---->By the way, for some devices which use ksproxy filter, the pending event may block the `Stop`[3] function (and also the following `client_.reset()`):<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>media_control_->Stop()<span class="line"><!---->media_control_-&gt;Stop()<!----></span><br>  => quartz!CFGControl::CImplMediaControl::Stop<span class="line"><!---->  =&gt; quartz!CFGControl::CImplMediaControl::Stop<!----></span><br>    => quartz!CFilterGraph::Stop<span class="line"><!---->    =&gt; quartz!CFilterGraph::Stop<!----></span><br>     => for i in filters : i->Stop()<span class="line"><!---->     =&gt; for i in filters : i-&gt;Stop()<!----></span><br>           => FilterBase::Stop() [4]<span class="line"><!---->           =&gt; FilterBase::Stop() [4]<!----></span><br>           => ksproxy!CKsProxy::Stop<span class="line"><!---->           =&gt; ksproxy!CKsProxy::Stop<!----></span><br>             => ksproxy!CKsOutputPin::Inactive<span class="line"><!---->             =&gt; ksproxy!CKsOutputPin::Inactive<!----></span><br>CKsOutputPin::Inactive(CKsOutputPin *this){<span class="line"><!---->CKsOutputPin::Inactive(CKsOutputPin *this){<!----></span><br>	[...]<span class="line"><!---->	[...]<!----></span><br>	 if ( this->m_PendingIoCount )<span class="line"><!---->	 if ( this-&gt;m_PendingIoCount )<!----></span><br>       WaitForSingleObjectEx(this->m_PendingIoCompletedEvent, 0xFFFFFFFF, 0); // will wait for the signal.<span class="line"><!---->       WaitForSingleObjectEx(this-&gt;m_PendingIoCompletedEvent, 0xFFFFFFFF, 0); // will wait for the signal.<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>This will prevent this race from happening.<span class="line"><!---->This will prevent this race from happening.<!----></span><br><br><br>But for the devices whose filter is implemented in a non-blocking way, this UAF will be unavoidable. Take obs virtual camera as an example:<span class="line"><!---->But for the devices whose filter is implemented in a non-blocking way, this UAF will be unavoidable. Take obs virtual camera as an example:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>media_control_->Stop()<span class="line"><!---->media_control_-&gt;Stop()<!----></span><br>  => quartz!CFGControl::CImplMediaControl::Stop<span class="line"><!---->  =&gt; quartz!CFGControl::CImplMediaControl::Stop<!----></span><br>    => quartz!CFilterGraph::Stop<span class="line"><!---->    =&gt; quartz!CFilterGraph::Stop<!----></span><br>     => for i in filters : i->Stop()<span class="line"><!---->     =&gt; for i in filters : i-&gt;Stop()<!----></span><br>           => FilterBase::Stop() [4]<span class="line"><!---->           =&gt; FilterBase::Stop() [4]<!----></span><br>           => obs_virtualcam_module64!DShow::OutputFilter::Stop<span class="line"><!---->           =&gt; obs_virtualcam_module64!DShow::OutputFilter::Stop<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>`obs_virtualcam_module64!DShow::OutputFilter::Stop` will not wait for the signal.<span class="line"><!---->`obs_virtualcam_module64!DShow::OutputFilter::Stop` will not wait for the signal.<!----></span><br><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=555;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<a class="undefined" <span class="line"><!---->[4]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/filter_base_win.cc;l=115;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<a Suggestion:<span class="line"><!---->Fix Suggestion:<!----></span><br><br>diff --git a/media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc b/media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc<span b/media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc<!----></span><br>@@ -897,9 +897,12 @@ void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived(const uint8_t* buffer,<span class="line"><!---->@@ -897,9 +897,12 @@ void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived(const uint8_t* buffer,<!----></span><br>   // DXVA_ExtendedFormat. Then use its fields DXVA_VideoPrimaries,<span class="line"><!---->   // DXVA_ExtendedFormat. Then use its fields DXVA_VideoPrimaries,<!----></span><br>   // DXVA_VideoTransferMatrix, DXVA_VideoTransferFunction and<span class="line"><!---->   // DXVA_VideoTransferMatrix, DXVA_VideoTransferFunction and<!----></span><br>   // DXVA_NominalRangeto build a gfx::ColorSpace. See <span class="line"><!---->   // DXVA_NominalRangeto build a gfx::ColorSpace. See <!----></span>http://crbug.com/959992<a class="" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=959992" title="Video capture with DirectShow does not take color space into account"><!---->http://crbug.com/959992<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br>-  client_->OnIncomingCapturedData(buffer, length, format, gfx::ColorSpace(),<span class="line"><!---->-  client_-&gt;OnIncomingCapturedData(buffer, length, format, gfx::ColorSpace(),<!----></span><br>+  {<span class="line"><!---->+  {<!----></span><br>+    base::AutoLock lock(lock_);<span client_-&gt;OnIncomingCapturedData(buffer, length, format, gfx::ColorSpace(),<!----></span><br>                                   camera_rotation_.value(), flip_y,<span class="line"><!---->                                   camera_rotation_.value(), flip_y,<!----></span><br>                                   base::TimeTicks::Now(), timestamp);<span class="line"><!---->                                   base::TimeTicks::Now(), timestamp);<!----></span><br>+  }<span class="line"><!---->+  }<!----></span><br><br>   while (!take_photo_callbacks_.empty()) {<span class="line"><!---->   while (!take_photo_callbacks_.empty()) {<!----></span><br>     TakePhotoCallback cb = std::move(take_photo_callbacks_.front());<span class="line"><!---->     TakePhotoCallback cb = std::move(take_photo_callbacks_.front());<!----></span><br><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: win<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: win<!----></span><br><br>Bisect:<span class="line"><!---->Bisect:<!----></span><br><br>Issue 1137308<span class="line"><!---->Issue 1137308<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>added a lock `lock_` to solve the race problem. But since [a], it changed the scope of `lock_` in order to fix deadlock, which let the UAF free again.<span class="line"><!---->added a lock `lock_` to solve the race problem. But since [a], it changed the scope of `lock_` in order to fix deadlock, which let the UAF free again.<!----></span><br><br>[a]. <span class="line"><!---->[a]. --user-data-dir=xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome.exe --user-data-dir=xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br><br>(Make sure your device has a camera, you can download the obs and use its virtual camera: <span class="line"><!---->(Make sure your device has a camera, you can download the obs and use its virtual camera: <!----></span>https://obsproject.com/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://obsproject.com/"><!---->https://obsproject.com/<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br><br>Type of crash: VideoCaptureService utility process, medium integrity as browser process on Win.<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: VideoCaptureService utility process, medium integrity as browser process on Win.<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file.<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan file.<!----></span><br><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang         Yes, this is a real issue. Previously there was a deadlock there, so the locking was relaxed. Turns out it was relaxed too much.<span class="line"><!---->Yes, this is a real issue. Previously there was a deadlock there, so the locking was relaxed. Turns out it was relaxed too much.<!----></span><br><br>However, I suggest not to grab the lock two times, but hold it throughout the |VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived|.<span class="line"><!---->However, I suggest not to grab the lock two times, but hold it throughout the |VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived|.<!----></span><br><br>I'm working on a fix.<span class="line"><!---->I'm working on a fix.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;

        }

          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;

          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;

          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

          min-width: 256px;

          padding: 0.5em 16px;

          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;

        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);

          overflow-y: auto;

          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
