      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

  }

    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>
      
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>There is a race between `client_.reset` and `client_->OnIncomingCapturedData`:<span class="line"><!---->There is a race between `client_.reset` and `client_-&gt;OnIncomingCapturedData`:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::StopAndDeAllocate() {<span class="line"><!---->void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::StopAndDeAllocate() {<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>  HRESULT hr = media_control_->Stop();    // <<<---------[3]<span class="line"><!---->  HRESULT hr = media_control_-&gt;Stop();    // &lt;&lt;&lt;---------[3]<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>  {<span class="line"><!---->  {<!----></span><br>    base::AutoLock lock(lock_);<span class="line"><!---->    base::AutoLock lock(lock_);<!----></span><br>    client_.reset();   //<<<------[1]<span class="line"><!---->    client_.reset();   //&lt;&lt;&lt;------[1]<!----></span><br>    state_ = kIdle;<span class="line"><!---->    state_ = kIdle;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived(const uint8_t* buffer,<span class="line"><!---->void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived(const uint8_t* buffer,<!----></span><br>                                          int length,<span class="line"><!---->                                          int length,<!----></span><br>                                          const VideoCaptureFormat& format,<span class="line"><!---->                                          const VideoCaptureFormat&amp; format,<!----></span><br>                                          base::TimeDelta timestamp,<span class="line"><!---->                                          base::TimeDelta timestamp,<!----></span><br>                                          bool flip_y) {<span class="line"><!---->                                          bool flip_y) {<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>  client_->OnIncomingCapturedData(buffer, length, format, gfx::ColorSpace(),   //<<<------[2]<span class="line"><!---->  client_-&gt;OnIncomingCapturedData(buffer, length, format, gfx::ColorSpace(),   //&lt;&lt;&lt;------[2]<!----></span><br>                                  camera_rotation_.value(), flip_y,<span class="line"><!---->                                  camera_rotation_.value(), flip_y,<!----></span><br>                                  base::TimeTicks::Now(), timestamp);<span class="line"><!---->                                  base::TimeTicks::Now(), timestamp);<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>So if the `client_` is reset during the execution of `OnIncomingCapturedData`, the uaf will be triggered.<span class="line"><!---->So if the `client_` is reset during the execution of `OnIncomingCapturedData`, the uaf will be triggered.<!----></span><br><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=568;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=568;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=568;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=900;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=900;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=900;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<!----></a><br><br><br>By the way, for some devices which use ksproxy filter, the pending event may block the `Stop`[3] function (and also the following `client_.reset()`):<span class="line"><!---->By the way, for some devices which use ksproxy filter, the pending event may block the `Stop`[3] function (and also the following `client_.reset()`):<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>media_control_->Stop()<span class="line"><!---->media_control_-&gt;Stop()<!----></span><br>  => quartz!CFGControl::CImplMediaControl::Stop<span class="line"><!---->  =&gt; quartz!CFGControl::CImplMediaControl::Stop<!----></span><br>    => quartz!CFilterGraph::Stop<span class="line"><!---->    =&gt; quartz!CFilterGraph::Stop<!----></span><br>     => for i in filters : i->Stop()<span class="line"><!---->     =&gt; for i in filters : i-&gt;Stop()<!----></span><br>           => FilterBase::Stop() [4]<span class="line"><!---->           =&gt; FilterBase::Stop() [4]<!----></span><br>           => ksproxy!CKsProxy::Stop<span class="line"><!---->           =&gt; ksproxy!CKsProxy::Stop<!----></span><br>             => ksproxy!CKsOutputPin::Inactive<span class="line"><!---->             =&gt; ksproxy!CKsOutputPin::Inactive<!----></span><br>CKsOutputPin::Inactive(CKsOutputPin *this){<span class="line"><!---->CKsOutputPin::Inactive(CKsOutputPin *this){<!----></span><br>	[...]<span class="line"><!---->	[...]<!----></span><br>	 if ( this->m_PendingIoCount )<span class="line"><!---->	 if ( this-&gt;m_PendingIoCount )<!----></span><br>       WaitForSingleObjectEx(this->m_PendingIoCompletedEvent, 0xFFFFFFFF, 0); // will wait for the signal.<span class="line"><!---->       WaitForSingleObjectEx(this-&gt;m_PendingIoCompletedEvent, 0xFFFFFFFF, 0); // will wait for the signal.<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>This will prevent this race from happening.<span class="line"><!---->This will prevent this race from happening.<!----></span><br><br><br>But for the devices whose filter is implemented in a non-blocking way, this UAF will be unavoidable. Take obs virtual camera as an example:<span class="line"><!---->But for the devices whose filter is implemented in a non-blocking way, this UAF will be unavoidable. Take obs virtual camera as an example:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>media_control_->Stop()<span class="line"><!---->media_control_-&gt;Stop()<!----></span><br>  => quartz!CFGControl::CImplMediaControl::Stop<span class="line"><!---->  =&gt; quartz!CFGControl::CImplMediaControl::Stop<!----></span><br>    => quartz!CFilterGraph::Stop<span class="line"><!---->    =&gt; quartz!CFilterGraph::Stop<!----></span><br>     => for i in filters : i->Stop()<span class="line"><!---->     =&gt; for i in filters : i-&gt;Stop()<!----></span><br>           => FilterBase::Stop() [4]<span class="line"><!---->           =&gt; FilterBase::Stop() [4]<!----></span><br>           => obs_virtualcam_module64!DShow::OutputFilter::Stop<span class="line"><!---->           =&gt; obs_virtualcam_module64!DShow::OutputFilter::Stop<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>`obs_virtualcam_module64!DShow::OutputFilter::Stop` will not wait for the signal.<span class="line"><!---->`obs_virtualcam_module64!DShow::OutputFilter::Stop` will not wait for the signal.<!----></span><br><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=555;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=555;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=555;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<!----></a><br>[4]. <span class="line"><!---->[4]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/filter_base_win.cc;l=115;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" Suggestion:<span class="line"><!---->Fix Suggestion:<!----></span><br><br>diff --git a/media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc b/media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc b/media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc<!----></span><br>index 459c5ae1cc4..c8d32703aec 100644<span b/media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc<!----></span><br>@@ -897,9 +897,12 @@ void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived(const uint8_t* buffer,<span class="line"><!---->@@ -897,9 +897,12 @@ void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived(const uint8_t* buffer,<!----></span><br>   // DXVA_ExtendedFormat. Then use its fields DXVA_VideoPrimaries,<span class="line"><!---->   // DXVA_ExtendedFormat. Then use its fields DXVA_VideoPrimaries,<!----></span><br>   // DXVA_VideoTransferMatrix, DXVA_VideoTransferFunction and<span class="line"><!---->   // DXVA_VideoTransferMatrix, DXVA_VideoTransferFunction and<!----></span><br>   // DXVA_NominalRangeto build a gfx::ColorSpace. See <span class="line"><!---->   // DXVA_NominalRangeto build a gfx::ColorSpace. See <!----></span>http://crbug.com/959992<a class="" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=959992" title="Video capture with DirectShow does not take color space into account"><!---->http://crbug.com/959992<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br>-  client_->OnIncomingCapturedData(buffer, length, format, gfx::ColorSpace(),<span class="line"><!---->-  client_-&gt;OnIncomingCapturedData(buffer, length, format, gfx::ColorSpace(),<!----></span><br>+  {<span class="line"><!---->+  {<!----></span><br>+    base::AutoLock lock(lock_);<span                        camera_rotation_.value(), flip_y,<!----></span><br>                                   base::TimeTicks::Now(), timestamp);<span class="line"><!---->                                   base::TimeTicks::Now(), timestamp);<!----></span><br>+  }<span class="line"><!---->+  }<!----></span><br><br>   while (!take_photo_callbacks_.empty()) {<span class="line"><!---->   while (!take_photo_callbacks_.empty()) {<!----></span><br>     TakePhotoCallback cb = std::move(take_photo_callbacks_.front());<span class="line"><!---->     TakePhotoCallback cb = std::move(take_photo_callbacks_.front());<!----></span><br><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: win<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: win<!----></span><br><br>Bisect:<span class="line"><!---->Bisect:<!----></span><br><br>Issue 1137308<span class="line"><!---->Issue 1137308<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>added a lock `lock_` to solve the race problem. But since [a], it changed the scope of `lock_` in order to fix deadlock, which let the UAF free again.<span class="line"><!---->added a lock `lock_` to solve the race problem. But since [a], it changed the scope of `lock_` in order to fix deadlock, which let the UAF free again.<!----></span><br><br>[a]. <span class="line"><!---->[a]. --user-data-dir=xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome.exe --user-data-dir=xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" and use its virtual camera: <span class="line"><!---->(Make sure your device has a camera, you can download the obs and use its virtual camera: <!----></span>https://obsproject.com/<a integrity as browser process on Win.<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: VideoCaptureService utility process, medium integrity as browser process on Win.<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan         by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1381401#c7">Comment 7<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1381401#c7">Comment 7<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Nov 8, 2022, 4:50 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Yes, this is a real issue. Previously there was a deadlock there, so the locking was relaxed. Turns out it was relaxed too much.<span class="line"><!---->Yes, this is a real issue. Previously there was a deadlock there, so the locking was relaxed. Turns out it was relaxed too much.<!----></span><br><br>However, I suggest not to grab the lock two times, but hold it throughout the |VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived|.<span class="line"><!---->However, I suggest not to grab the lock two times, but hold it throughout the |VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived|.<!----></span><br><br>I'm working on a fix.<span class="line"><!---->I'm working on a fix.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, Leecraso! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $7000 for this report of a mildly mitigated security bug (must allow web content access to camera) + $3000 for renderer bonus + $1000 bisect bonus for a total reward for $11,000. Thank you efforts in discovering and reporting this issue to us!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Leecraso! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $7000 for this report of a mildly mitigated security bug (must allow web content access to camera) + $3000 for renderer bonus + $1000 bisect bonus for a total reward for $11,000.         Hello! Yes, thank you for the ping-- the credit has been updated on the release blog as well as our database of email<->credit conversion so the automation will use the 360 VRI credit from now on.<span class="line"><!---->Hello! Yes, thank you for the ping-- the credit has been updated on the release blog as well as our database of email&lt;-&gt;credit conversion so the automation will use the 360 VRI credit from now on.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }

          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->select the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>There is a race between `client_.reset` and `client_->OnIncomingCapturedData`:<span class="line"><!---->There is a race between `client_.reset` and `client_-&gt;OnIncomingCapturedData`:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::StopAndDeAllocate() {<span class="line"><!---->void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::StopAndDeAllocate() {<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>  HRESULT hr = media_control_->Stop();    // <<<---------[3]<span class="line"><!---->  HRESULT hr = media_control_-&gt;Stop();    // &lt;&lt;&lt;---------[3]<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>  {<span class="line"><!---->  {<!----></span><br>    base::AutoLock lock(lock_);<span class="line"><!---->    base::AutoLock lock(lock_);<!----></span><br>    client_.reset();   //<<<------[1]<span class="line"><!---->    client_.reset();   //&lt;&lt;&lt;------[1]<!----></span><br>    state_ = kIdle;<span class="line"><!---->    state_ = kIdle;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived(const uint8_t* buffer,<span class="line"><!---->void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived(const uint8_t* buffer,<!----></span><br>                                          int length,<span class="line"><!---->                                          int length,<!----></span><br>                                          const VideoCaptureFormat& format,<span class="line"><!---->                                          const VideoCaptureFormat&amp; format,<!----></span><br>                                          base::TimeDelta timestamp,<span class="line"><!---->                                          base::TimeDelta timestamp,<!----></span><br>                                          bool flip_y) {<span class="line"><!---->                                          bool flip_y) {<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>  client_->OnIncomingCapturedData(buffer, length, format, gfx::ColorSpace(),   //<<<------[2]<span class="line"><!---->  client_-&gt;OnIncomingCapturedData(buffer, length, format, gfx::ColorSpace(),   //&lt;&lt;&lt;------[2]<!----></span><br>                                  camera_rotation_.value(), flip_y,<span class="line"><!---->                                  camera_rotation_.value(), flip_y,<!----></span><br>                                  base::TimeTicks::Now(), timestamp);<span class="line"><!---->                                  base::TimeTicks::Now(), timestamp);<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>So if the `client_` is reset during the execution of `OnIncomingCapturedData`, the uaf will be triggered.<span class="line"><!---->So if the `client_` is reset during the execution of `OnIncomingCapturedData`, the uaf will be triggered.<!----></span><br><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=568;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=568;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=568;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=900;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=900;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=900;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<!----></a><br><br><br>By the way, for some devices which use ksproxy filter, the pending event may block the `Stop`[3] function (and also the following `client_.reset()`):<span class="line"><!---->By the way, for some devices which use ksproxy filter, the pending event may block the `Stop`[3] function (and also the following `client_.reset()`):<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>media_control_->Stop()<span class="line"><!---->media_control_-&gt;Stop()<!----></span><br>  => quartz!CFGControl::CImplMediaControl::Stop<span class="line"><!---->  =&gt; quartz!CFGControl::CImplMediaControl::Stop<!----></span><br>    => quartz!CFilterGraph::Stop<span class="line"><!---->    =&gt; quartz!CFilterGraph::Stop<!----></span><br>     => for i in filters : i->Stop()<span class="line"><!---->     =&gt; for i in filters : i-&gt;Stop()<!----></span><br>           => FilterBase::Stop() [4]<span class="line"><!---->           =&gt; FilterBase::Stop() [4]<!----></span><br>           => ksproxy!CKsProxy::Stop<span class="line"><!---->           =&gt; ksproxy!CKsProxy::Stop<!----></span><br>             => ksproxy!CKsOutputPin::Inactive<span class="line"><!---->             =&gt; ksproxy!CKsOutputPin::Inactive<!----></span><br>CKsOutputPin::Inactive(CKsOutputPin *this){<span class="line"><!---->CKsOutputPin::Inactive(CKsOutputPin *this){<!----></span><br>	[...]<span class="line"><!---->	[...]<!----></span><br>	 if ( this->m_PendingIoCount )<span class="line"><!---->	 if ( this-&gt;m_PendingIoCount )<!----></span><br>       WaitForSingleObjectEx(this->m_PendingIoCompletedEvent, 0xFFFFFFFF, 0); // will wait for the signal.<span class="line"><!---->       WaitForSingleObjectEx(this-&gt;m_PendingIoCompletedEvent, 0xFFFFFFFF, 0); // will wait for the signal.<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>This will prevent this race from happening.<span class="line"><!---->This will prevent this race from happening.<!----></span><br><br><br>But for the devices whose filter is implemented in a non-blocking way, this UAF will be unavoidable. Take obs virtual camera as an example:<span class="line"><!---->But for the devices whose filter is implemented in a non-blocking way, this UAF will be unavoidable. Take obs virtual camera as an example:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>media_control_->Stop()<span class="line"><!---->media_control_-&gt;Stop()<!----></span><br>  => quartz!CFGControl::CImplMediaControl::Stop<span class="line"><!---->  =&gt; quartz!CFGControl::CImplMediaControl::Stop<!----></span><br>    => quartz!CFilterGraph::Stop<span class="line"><!---->    =&gt; quartz!CFilterGraph::Stop<!----></span><br>     => for i in filters : i->Stop()<span class="line"><!---->     =&gt; for i in filters : i-&gt;Stop()<!----></span><br>           => FilterBase::Stop() [4]<span class="line"><!---->           =&gt; FilterBase::Stop() [4]<!----></span><br>           => obs_virtualcam_module64!DShow::OutputFilter::Stop<span class="line"><!---->           =&gt; obs_virtualcam_module64!DShow::OutputFilter::Stop<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>`obs_virtualcam_module64!DShow::OutputFilter::Stop` will not wait for the signal.<span class="line"><!---->`obs_virtualcam_module64!DShow::OutputFilter::Stop` will not wait for the signal.<!----></span><br><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=555;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=555;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=555;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<!----></a><br>[4]. <span class="line"><!---->[4]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/filter_base_win.cc;l=115;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<a integrity as browser process on Win.<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: VideoCaptureService utility process, medium integrity as browser process on Win.<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan         Yes, this is a real issue. Previously there was a deadlock there, so the locking was relaxed. Turns out it was relaxed too much.<span class="line"><!---->Yes, this is a real issue. Previously there was a deadlock there, so the locking was relaxed. Turns out it was relaxed too much.<!----></span><br><br>However, I suggest not to grab the lock two times, but hold it throughout the |VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived|.<span class="line"><!---->However, I suggest not to grab the lock two times, but hold it throughout the |VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived|.<!----></span><br><br>I'm working on a fix.<span class="line"><!---->I'm working on a fix.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, Leecraso! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $7000 for this report of a mildly mitigated security bug (must allow web content access to camera) + $3000 for renderer bonus + $1000 bisect bonus for a total reward for $11,000. Thank you efforts in discovering and reporting this issue to us!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Leecraso! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $7000 for this report of a mildly mitigated security bug (must allow web content access to camera) + $3000 for renderer bonus + $1000 bisect bonus for a total reward for $11,000.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

         * is disabled for this component.

          display: block;

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
