      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>There is a race between `client_.reset` and `client_->OnIncomingCapturedData`:<span class="line"><!---->There is a race between `client_.reset` and `client_-&gt;OnIncomingCapturedData`:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::StopAndDeAllocate() {<span class="line"><!---->void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::StopAndDeAllocate() {<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>  HRESULT hr = media_control_->Stop();    // <<<---------[3]<span class="line"><!---->  HRESULT hr = media_control_-&gt;Stop();    // &lt;&lt;&lt;---------[3]<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>  {<span class="line"><!---->  {<!----></span><br>    base::AutoLock lock(lock_);<span class="line"><!---->    base::AutoLock lock(lock_);<!----></span><br>    client_.reset();   //<<<------[1]<span class="line"><!---->    client_.reset();   //&lt;&lt;&lt;------[1]<!----></span><br>    state_ = kIdle;<span class="line"><!---->    state_ = kIdle;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived(const uint8_t* buffer,<span class="line"><!---->void VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived(const uint8_t* buffer,<!----></span><br>                                          int length,<span class="line"><!---->                                          int length,<!----></span><br>                                          const VideoCaptureFormat& format,<span class="line"><!---->                                          const VideoCaptureFormat&amp; format,<!----></span><br>                                          base::TimeDelta timestamp,<span class="line"><!---->                                          base::TimeDelta timestamp,<!----></span><br>                                          bool flip_y) {<span class="line"><!---->                                          bool flip_y) {<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>  client_->OnIncomingCapturedData(buffer, length, format, gfx::ColorSpace(),   //<<<------[2]<span class="line"><!---->  client_-&gt;OnIncomingCapturedData(buffer, length, format, gfx::ColorSpace(),   //&lt;&lt;&lt;------[2]<!----></span><br>                                  camera_rotation_.value(), flip_y,<span class="line"><!---->                                  camera_rotation_.value(), flip_y,<!----></span><br>                                  base::TimeTicks::Now(), timestamp);<span class="line"><!---->                                  base::TimeTicks::Now(), timestamp);<!----></span><br>  [...]<span class="line"><!---->  [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>So if the `client_` is reset during the execution of `OnIncomingCapturedData`, the uaf will be triggered.<span class="line"><!---->So if the `client_` is reset during the execution of `OnIncomingCapturedData`, the uaf will be triggered.<!----></span><br><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=568;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=568;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=568;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=900;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=900;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/win/video_capture_device_win.cc;l=900;drc=d387f092f963cdceb9568d3a589686f7cf0e5986<!----></a><br><br><br>By the way, for some devices which use ksproxy filter, the pending event may block the `Stop`[3] function (and also the following `client_.reset()`):<span class="line"><!---->By the way, for some devices which use ksproxy filter, the pending event may block the `Stop`[3] function (and also the following `client_.reset()`):<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>media_control_->Stop()<span class="line"><!---->media_control_-&gt;Stop()<!----></span><br>  => quartz!CFGControl::CImplMediaControl::Stop<span class="line"><!---->  =&gt; quartz!CFGControl::CImplMediaControl::Stop<!----></span><br>    => quartz!CFilterGraph::Stop<span class="line"><!---->    =&gt; quartz!CFilterGraph::Stop<!----></span><br>     => for i in filters : i->Stop()<span class="line"><!---->     =&gt; for i in filters : i-&gt;Stop()<!----></span><br>           => FilterBase::Stop() [4]<span class="line"><!---->           =&gt; FilterBase::Stop() [4]<!----></span><br>           => ksproxy!CKsProxy::Stop<span class="line"><!---->           =&gt; ksproxy!CKsProxy::Stop<!----></span><br>             => ksproxy!CKsOutputPin::Inactive<span class="line"><!---->             =&gt; ksproxy!CKsOutputPin::Inactive<!----></span><br>CKsOutputPin::Inactive(CKsOutputPin *this){<span class="line"><!---->CKsOutputPin::Inactive(CKsOutputPin *this){<!----></span><br>	[...]<span class="line"><!---->	[...]<!----></span><br>	 if ( this->m_PendingIoCount )<span class="line"><!---->	 if ( this-&gt;m_PendingIoCount )<!----></span><br>       WaitForSingleObjectEx(this->m_PendingIoCompletedEvent, 0xFFFFFFFF, 0); // will wait for the signal.<span class="line"><!---->       WaitForSingleObjectEx(this-&gt;m_PendingIoCompletedEvent, 0xFFFFFFFF, 0); // will wait for the signal.<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>This will prevent this race from happening.<span class="line"><!---->This will prevent this race from happening.<!----></span><br><br><br>But for the devices whose filter is implemented in a non-blocking way, this UAF will be unavoidable. Take obs virtual camera as an example:<span class="line"><!---->But for the devices whose filter is implemented in a non-blocking way, this UAF will be unavoidable. Take obs virtual camera as an example:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>media_control_->Stop()<span class="line"><!---->media_control_-&gt;Stop()<!----></span><br>     =&gt; obs_virtualcam_module64!DShow::OutputFilter::Stop<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>`obs_virtualcam_module64!DShow::OutputFilter::Stop` will not wait for the signal.<span class="line"><!---->`obs_virtualcam_module64!DShow::OutputFilter::Stop` will not wait for the signal.<!----></span><br><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3].         Yes, this is a real issue. Previously there was a deadlock there, so the locking was relaxed. Turns out it was relaxed too much.<span class="line"><!---->Yes, this is a real issue. Previously there was a deadlock there, so the locking was relaxed. Turns out it was relaxed too much.<!----></span><br><br>However, I suggest not to grab the lock two times, but hold it throughout the |VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived|.<span class="line"><!---->However, I suggest not to grab the lock two times, but hold it throughout the |VideoCaptureDeviceWin::FrameReceived|.<!----></span><br><br>I'm working on a fix.<span class="line"><!---->I'm working on a fix.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, Leecraso! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $7000 for this report of a mildly mitigated security bug (must allow web content access to camera) + $3000 for renderer bonus + $1000 bisect bonus for a total reward for $11,000. Thank you efforts in discovering and reporting this issue to us!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Leecraso! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $7000 for this report of a mildly mitigated security bug (must allow web content access to camera) + $3000 for renderer bonus + $1000 bisect bonus for a total reward for $11,000. Thank you efforts in discovering and reporting this issue to us!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

        </span>

          </tbody>
        </table>

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
